description.compact: Class to access general resources from the create send API.
Get the authorization URL for your application, given the application's Client ID, Client Secret, Redirect URI, Scope, and optional state data.

param.description: The Client ID of your registered OAuth application.
The Redirect URI of your registered OAuth application.
The comma-separated permission scope your application requires.
Optional state data to be included in the URL.

return.description: The authorization URL to which users of your application should be redirected.

description.compact: Exchange a provided OAuth code for an OAuth access token, 'expires in' value and refresh token.

param.description: The Client ID of your registered OAuth application.
The Client Secret of your registered OAuth application.
The Redirect URI of your registered OAuth application.
The unique OAuth code to be exchanged for an access token.

return.description: A successful response will be an object of the form

param.description: Authentication details to use for API calls.

docblock.param:
This array must take one of the following forms: If using OAuth to authenticate: array( 'access_token' => 'your access token', 'refresh_token' => 'your refresh token')
Or if using an API key: array('api_key' => 'your api key')

param.description: The protocol to use for requests (http|https)
The level of debugging required CS_REST_LOG_NONE | CS_REST_LOG_ERROR | CS_REST_LOG_WARNING | CS_REST_LOG_VERBOSE
The host to send API requests to. There is no need to change this
The logger to use. Used for dependency injection
serialiser to use. Used for dependency injection
transport to use. Used for dependency injection

description.compact: Retrieves the email address of the primary contact for this account

return.description: a successful response will be an array in the form:

docblock.return: array('EmailAddress'=> email address of primary contact)

description.compact: Assigns the primary contact for this account to the administrator with the specified email address

param.description: The email address of the administrator designated to be the primary contact

return.description: a successful response will be an array in the form:

docblock.return: array('EmailAddress'=> email address of primary contact)

description.compact: Get a URL which initiates a new external session for the user with the given email.

param.description: Options for initiating the external login session.

docblock.param: This should be an array of the form: array( 'Email' => 'The email address of the Campaign Monitor user for whom the login session should be created', 'Chrome' => 'Which 'chrome' to display - Must be either "all", "tabs", or "none"', 'Url' => 'The URL to display once logged in. e.g. "/subscribers/"', 'IntegratorID' => 'The Integrator ID. You need to contact Campaign Monitor support to get an Integrator ID.', 'ClientID' => 'The Client ID of the client which should be active once logged in to the Campaign Monitor account.' )

return.description: A successful response will be an array of the form:

description.compact: The protocol to use while accessing the api
The base route of the create send api.
The serialiser to use for serialisation and deserialisation of API request and response data
The transport to use to send API requests

var.description: or CS_REST_SocketTransport or your own custom transport.

description.compact: The logger to use for debugging of all API requests
The default options to use for each API request.

docblock.description:
These can be overridden by passing in an array as the call_options argument to a single api request. Valid options are:
deserialise boolean: Set this to false if you want to get the raw response. This can be useful if your passing json directly to javascript.
While there are clearly other options there is no need to change them.

param.description: Authentication details to use for API calls.

docblock.param:
This array must take one of the following forms: If using OAuth to authenticate: array( 'access_token' => 'your access token', 'refresh_token' => 'your refresh token')
Or if using an API key: array('api_key' => 'your api key')
Note that this method will continue to work in the deprecated case when $auth_details is passed in as a string containing an API key.

param.description: The protocol to use for requests (http|https)
The level of debugging required CS_REST_LOG_NONE | CS_REST_LOG_ERROR | CS_REST_LOG_WARNING | CS_REST_LOG_VERBOSE
The host to send API requests to. There is no need to change this
The logger to use. Used for dependency injection
serialiser to use. Used for dependency injection
transport to use. Used for dependency injection

comment.value: If $auth_details is a string, assume it is an API key

description.compact: Refresh the current OAuth token using the current refresh token.

return.description: True if the wrapper is using SSL.

description.compact: Internal method to make a general API request based on the provided options
